channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration prepares to withdraw USAID staff from overseas posts by weekend
item.description: "We are being tasked to assist the Department in recalling USAID employees to the United States by Saturday," State Department official Seth Green wrote in an email to staff on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
"We are being tasked to assist the Department in recalling USAID employees to the United States by Saturday," State Department official Seth Green wrote in an email to staff on Tuesday.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: FBI gives Justice details on employees who worked Jan. 6 cases, FBI agents sue
item.description: The details on FBI employees comes in response to a Justice Department memo last week, asking for names of all current and former FBI personnel who worked on Jan. 6 cases or the prosecution of Hamas leaders.
item.content:encoded:
The details on FBI employees comes in response to a Justice Department memo last week, asking for names of all current and former FBI personnel who worked on Jan. 6 cases or the prosecution of Hamas leaders.

(Image credit: Brent Stirton)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: What is the Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE?
item.description: President Trump said the entity would focus on cutting government waste and slashing federal regulations, and he put tech billionaire and adviser Elon Musk in charge.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the entity would focus on cutting government waste and slashing federal regulations, and he put tech billionaire and adviser Elon Musk in charge.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: A guide to what the U.S. Education Department does (and doesn't) do
item.description: The department tracks student achievement, manages college financial aid and sends K-12 schools money to support students with disabilities and lower-income communities, among other things.
item.content:encoded:
The department tracks student achievement, manages college financial aid and sends K-12 schools money to support students with disabilities and lower-income communities, among other things.

(Image credit: LA Johnson)
item.dc:creator: Nicole Cohen

item.title: Miami Beach is continuing to crack down on spring break partiers
item.description: It started last year, when the city launched an expensive ad campaign telling spring breakers that the party was over and announcing new curfews and fines, as well as heavier law enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
It started last year, when the city launched an expensive ad campaign telling spring breakers that the party was over and announcing new curfews and fines, as well as heavier law enforcement.

(Image credit: Giorgio Viera)
item.dc:creator: Manuela LÃ³pez Restrepo

item.title: The prospect of immigration agents entering schools is sending shockwaves among communities
item.description: President Trump got rid of a decades-old policy that prevented agents from arresting migrants without legal status in sensitive places, such as schools. Most districts are drawing a line in the sand.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump got rid of a decades-old policy that prevented agents from arresting migrants without legal status in sensitive places, such as schools. Most districts are drawing a line in the sand.

(Image credit: Mustafa Hussain for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Winter storm to move across U.S. but the South will see record high temps
item.description: Parts of the South will see high temperatures while upper parts of the U.S. will see wintry weather.
item.content:encoded:
Parts of the South will see high temperatures while upper parts of the U.S. will see wintry weather.

(Image credit: NOAA)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Trump says he wants the U.S. to take ownership of the Gaza Strip
item.description: Trump said he and Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu talked Tuesday about relocating Palestinians and leveling Gaza, which he suggested could be the "Riviera of the Middle East" under U.S. ownership.
item.content:encoded:
Trump said he and Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu talked Tuesday about relocating Palestinians and leveling Gaza, which he suggested could be the "Riviera of the Middle East" under U.S. ownership.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Franco OrdoÃ±ez

item.title: The first group of migrants has been sent to GuantÃ¡namo, but legal challenges loom
item.description: President Trump aims to deport up to 30,000 migrant detainees to a holding facility there, despite the questionable legality of that move.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump aims to deport up to 30,000 migrant detainees to a holding facility there, despite the questionable legality of that move.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: A sense of foreboding hangs over the National Institutes of Health
item.description: There's widespread confusion and fear among scientists and doctors on the sprawling National Institutes of Health campus and at institutions dependent on the agency's funding.
item.content:encoded: There's widespread confusion and fear among scientists and doctors on the sprawling National Institutes of Health campus and at institutions dependent on the agency's funding.
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein
